result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan E. BURTON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$120.00 of the buy money to Metro Drug Unit is ordered joint and several with Eric Schwarz)

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

No contact with Eric Schwarz.

Any and all counseling as recommended by the department.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Order Reinstating Huber Privileges.
It is hereby ordered:
1) the defendant's huber privileges are restored as of 12-14-15.
2) the court further orders that in the future, if the jail files a report indicating the defendant has violated any term of Huber or other jail rules, the court will sign that request terminating Huber without a hearing.

The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample at this time.

Minutes.
Re:  Deliver Heroin, on 10-01-14.

Defendant in custody.  
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 cts. Deliver Heroin, Deliver Heroin within 1,000 feet of park, and PTC Deliver Heroin.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-22-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Eric Schwarz and defendant is not to travel outside of Manitowoc County.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
